document_type: Final Determination Notification and Payroll Records
security: Redactions are made to protect Social Security numbers, citing that public disclosure could reasonably constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy which outweighs the public interest.
summary: This document is a final determination notification from the Assassination Records Review Board regarding the release status of HSCA staff payroll records, specifically addressing postponements related to Social Security numbers to protect personal privacy.
summary_one_paragraph: The Assassination Records Review Board issued a final determination on December 8, 1995, regarding HSCA staff payroll records (Record Number 180-10060-10499), deciding to postpone in part the release of information. The postponements, representing Social Security numbers, were implemented to prevent an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, balancing the significant historical interest in the document against privacy concerns. The document includes payroll authorization forms and related memoranda for Mary Elizabeth Ponder, detailing her employment history with the Select Committee on Assassinations, with a date of next review set for 2017.
title: Final Determination Notification Regarding HSCA Staff Payroll Records
sender: Budget Officer (HSCA) and Assassination Records Review Board
